• BioBank Connect envisions a unified, secure and intelligent digital registry for organ donation and transplantation management.
  • It enables hospitals to register donors and recipients digitally, capturing essential medical compatibility details such as blood type, organ type, and geographic proximity.
  • Integration with authorized medical databases ensures authenticity and compliance with healthcare standards.
  • Automated alerts notify hospitals and transplant coordinators when a match is found, reducing human delays.
  • Families receive transparent communication and consent tracking, ensuring ethical and timely processes.
  • Over time, the system can analyze donor trends, improve national organ donation rates, and save countless lives through faster matching and reduced wastage of viable organs.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Organ donation and transplantation processes remain largely manual in many countries. Hospitals, NGOs, and government bodies maintain separate databases, often leading to mismatched or delayed donor-recipient connections. In urgent cases, this fragmentation can mean the difference between life and death. Moreover, the lack of transparency and public awareness discourages potential donors from registering.
